pullRequest.body:
This PR adds a few lemmas about GroupsWithZero, more precisely:

- the lemmas `zero_pow_eq_oneâ‚€`, `zero_zpow_eq_oneâ‚€` to Algebra.GroupWithZero.Basic and 

- `zpow_le_zpow_iff_right_of_lt_oneâ‚€`, `zpow_lt_zpow_iff_right_of_lt_oneâ‚€` and `zpow_eq_one_iff_rightâ‚€` to Algebra.Order.GroupWithZero.Unbundled.

Used in project Formalization of the Bruhat-Tits Tree.
Co-authored-by: Christian Merten <christian@merten.dev>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

maintainer merge

Thanks for the lemmas! As previously stated, `LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero` and all its files are on their way to being deprecated because all lemmas can be generalised to also include linear ordered semifields. Here are indications on how to generalise everything.
Don't forget to update the PR description

LGTM, thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This can be made an iff, is true under the mere assumptions `[MonoidWithZero Mâ‚€] [Nontrivial Mâ‚€]`, and should be located in `Algebra.GroupWithZero.Basic` just after `zero_pow_eq`
Ok, I made it an iff and moved it to the place you suggested.
This can be made an iff, is true under the mere assumptions `[GroupWithZero Mâ‚€] [Nontrivial Mâ‚€]`, and should be located in `Algebra.GroupWithZero.Basic` just after `zero_zpow_eq`
made it into an iff statement, and moved it to the suggested place.
This is a special case of `zpow_lt_zpow_right_of_lt_oneâ‚€` and should be deleted

I'm confused. The conclusion of your lemma [zpow_lt_zpow_right_of_lt_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#zpow_lt_zpow_right_of_lt_one%E2%82%80)â‚€ is `a ^ n â‰¤ a ^ m`, and not 
`a ^ n < a ^ m `. 
(From the name I would have expected the conclusion to be `a ^ n < a ^ m `.)
I do want the version with strict inequality.
Whoops, looks like a typo. It should say `<`. Feel free to fix it in this PR.

I think your lemma [zpow_lt_zpow_right_of_lt_oneâ‚€](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#zpow_lt_zpow_right_of_lt_one%E2%82%80) is in fact lemma [zpow_le_zpow_right_of_le_oneâ‚€](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#zpow_le_zpow_right_of_le_one%E2%82%80).

I have fixed this, so that `zpow_lt_zpow_of_lt_oneâ‚€` is what it should be.
This is superseded by `zpow_le_zpow_iff_rightâ‚€` and should be deleted
deleted lemma
This can be made an iff, should be called `zpow_lt_zpow_iff_right_of_lt_oneâ‚€` and should be proved and located similarly to `zpow_lt_zpow_iff_rightâ‚€`
done, but could you please explain what "right" in the name means?
@YaelDillies Could you explain what the "right" in the name refers to?
It refers to the fact that we are considering the binary operator `^` as a function of its right argument, namely `a ^ Â·`. `_left` would refer to the function `Â· ^ n` instead
This can be made an iff, weakened to `a â‰  1`, and should be proved using and moved close to `zpow_right_injâ‚€`
done.

```suggestion
lemma zero_pow_eq_oneâ‚€ [Nontrivial Mâ‚€] : (0 : Mâ‚€) ^ n = 1 â†” n = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [zero_pow_eq, zero_ne_one.ite_eq_left]
```
Your suggestion doesn't seem to work.
I guess what you meant was: `rw [zero_pow_eq, one_ne_zero.ite_eq_left_iff]`. At least this seems to work.

```suggestion
lemma zero_zpow_eq_oneâ‚€ {n : â„¤} : (0 : Gâ‚€) ^ n = 1 â†” n = 0 := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [zero_zpow_eq, zero_ne_one.ite_eq_left]
```
same here, I'm getting an error message if I try the code

Oh the lemma is called `Ne.ite_eq_left_iff`, so I guess
```suggestion
  rw [zero_zpow_eq, zero_ne_one.ite_eq_left_iff]
```
Well and I guess I need to use `one_ne_zero` and not `zero_ne_one`.

```suggestion
lemma zpow_eq_oneâ‚€ (haâ‚€: 0 <= a) (haâ‚ : a â‰  1) {n : â„¤} : a ^ n = 1 â†” n = 0 := by
```
and can you please remove the `a = 0` special case you are introducing in this PR?

Sorry, writing from phone
I don't understand. I am assuming `0 < a` in the lemma.

Yes, but it's also true for `a = 0` (as per your lemma above), so you can generalise the proof ðŸ˜‰

I would simply start the proof with `obtain rfl | ha := ha.eq_or_lt`, reprove your above lemma in the first branch and move your current proof to the second branch
ah that's what you meant. ok, I've generalized it.

```suggestion
  simpa using zpow_right_injâ‚€ haâ‚€ haâ‚ (n := 0)
```

```suggestion
lemma zpow_eq_oneâ‚€ (haâ‚€ : 0 \le a)(haâ‚ : a â‰  1) {n : â„¤} : a ^ n = 1 â†” n = 0 := by
```
and we don't seem to have the `pow` version, could you add it as well?

```suggestion
lemma zpow_le_zpow_iff_right_of_lt_oneâ‚€ (haâ‚€ : 0 < a) (haâ‚ : a < 1) :
    a ^ m â‰¤ a ^ n â†” n â‰¤ m := (zpow_right_strictAntiâ‚€ haâ‚€ haâ‚).le_iff_le

lemma zpow_lt_zpow_iff_right_of_lt_oneâ‚€ (haâ‚€ : 0 < a) (haâ‚ : a < 1) :
    a ^ m < a ^ n â†” n < m := (zpow_right_strictAntiâ‚€ haâ‚€ haâ‚).lt_iff_lt
```

Apologies. One day we will have an autoformatter
```suggestion
lemma zpow_eq_oneâ‚€ (haâ‚€ : 0 â‰¤ a) (haâ‚ : a â‰  1) {n : â„¤} : a ^ n = 1 â†” n = 0 := by
```
I didn't find a `pow` version. Could you add it?
can we postpone this to a later PR as I think there are more lemmas missing for a `pow` version (at least if I try to do the proof in analogy with this one)

```suggestion
lemma zpow_eq_one_iff_rightâ‚€ (haâ‚€ : 0 â‰¤ a) (haâ‚ : a â‰  1) {n : â„¤} : a ^ n = 1 â†” n = 0 := by
```
to avoid confusion with lemmas like `pow_eq_one_iff`

You don't use `wlog` anymore
```suggestion
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `a ^ n = 1 â†” n = 0` and similar
